div.pre: 1917 South Italy, 1887 (505) Burial: c. 370 B.C.? (K) Contents: 22+ AR Taras: 3 st. (1 oecist; 2 horsemen, Per. II, D1, E5) Thurium: st. (incl. 2 signed Molossus) Caulonia: a few st. (late types) Croton: 1 st. (Hera/std. Heracles) Terina: c. 12 st. (incl. Regling 7-16, 30, 44, 62) Disposition: dispersed Evans, NC 1889, pp. 41-2 Evans dated the burial c. 388 B.C. in rela- tion to a supposed occupation of Terina in that year by Dionysius I, for which there appears to be no certain evidence (Regling, Terina, p. 5). The coins of Thurium, signed by Molossus, are probably somewhat later than this
